result.execSummary:
The defendant Garrett M Groer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Fine of $600.00 plus the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements.  Monies to be taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.

No contact with Jacob H. or Erin G.
No controlled substances other than those prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician for his mental or physical needs.  Must take medication as prescribed and remain in full compliance with any medication regimen.
No alcohol.
AODA assessment, treatment and aftercare.  Urine screens to ensure compliance.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Provide DNA sample unless previously provided.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms; and further advised of voting ineligibility.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Garrett M Groer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Denying Motion for Additional Sentence Credit signed and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Br. 25, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se motion for sentence credit.
Defendant's pro se motion for 29 days of sentence credit.
Original Transcript of PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING (29 pages) commencing 07/28/2015 received and filed.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Garrett M Groer not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel unable to appear; requested another date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Garrett M Groer not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of Sara Schroeder for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a date for plea and sentencing.  Order to produce needed; defendant is in the Wisconsin State Prison System.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. 
Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests,portable breathalyzers and SCRAM.

Defendant Garrett M Groer in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Garrett M Groer in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

/from Chief Deputy District Attorney dated 4/28/15, received and filed with:
 - Request for Prompt Disposition.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Garrett M Groer not in court.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 1/26/15 @ 1 PM
